website_summaries.verdict: This dual-sided espresso tamper seems to fit many DeLonghi portafilters well, but be sure to measure before ordering.
pros: Commercial quality, heavy die cast aluminum
Dual ends evenly distribute, compresses and levels grounds
Features two flat tamping sides Tamping sides are 51mm and 58mm
Resists corrosion from acids found in coffee
A good weight for tamping, at 2.4 oz
cons: Putting it in the dishwasher will damage finish
Not all tampers fit all espresso machine baskets well, so be sure to measure before ordering

customer_reviews.title: Nope. Amazon doesn't even want it back.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful. It's not machined correctly. The tamper isn't even close to 58/51. Tried to return it, but Amazon doesn't even want it back, so they refunded me instead. Not sure what the point of this tamper is except crazy cheap and very cheaply made. There's no way anyone should try to learn proper technique on this tamper.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Lehner

customer_reviews.title: It used to be much better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 3 years ago and I loved it. Recently I moved to a new place and couldn't find it so I bought another one. But I was surprised because it's absolutely not what I had been using for 3 years. The material is completely different. This one is made with much cheaper material and much lighter than the one I had. A tamper needs to be heavy so that it's own weight can help ease the process of pressing coffee. Also, as seen in the pic, there's a line that pops out, which clearly shows how poor the quality is. I'm truly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit for espresso
customer_reviews.text: This product is ROCK SOLID & VERY EASY TO CLEAN. HOWEVER watch out as it BARELY FITS my espresso coffee ground holder. It may not fit all machines. WHY MAKE it so darn large on both ends? Since can use either side it really needs to be re-designed on the smaller end! ESPECIALLY since vast majority users will be for espresso... just does not make sense! But is a great deal assuming price does not go up like seems a majority items I have bought on Amazon have done over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Dapper Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fits Delonghi EC680
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite new to the at home espresso world. I have a Delonghi EC680 (which I love!), but it came with a cheap plastic dual sided coffee scoop/tamper. It did the trick I guess but this one works much better. The smaller side fits perfectly and the bigger side is nice and easy to grip when tamping my espresso grounds. For the price, I just don't understand why Delonghi wouldn't include something like this with their machine in the first place. I've only washed this by hand, just a quick rinse and dry is pretty much all it needs.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Little Gadget
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to go with his espresso machine for xmas. He absolutely loves it cause the one the espresso machine came with had a scoop on one end and was plastic. It fit perfectly and is simple to wash, actually I think he just wipes it off cause its so easy to clean. It has a different size on each end Im assuming to make it universal for different machines. If you are buying a new machine I highly recommend you buy one cause its stainless steel not plastic. Buy it even if your not getting new espresso, It is worth it. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: 5 star tamper!
customer_reviews.text: I cantcfigirexoit why so many negative reviews? This is a great tamper for the price, doesn't have mold lines that would causing gaps when packing. The small end fits into my rates so cup and the larger end is easy to put pressure on to pack with. I don't wash it in the dishwasher, so haven't had any problem with it discoloring. Not sure why you'd want to wash it in a dishwasher anyway, it's easy to hand wash. Reqlly, since it's coffee grounds, I just wipe it off with a towel and haven't washed it. I rate this 5 stars and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: The Rancher's Wife

customer_reviews.title: A MUST!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought an espresso maker and the one it came with was made out of plastic and didn't really do well packed in the ground coffee and would often leave a mess and have ground on my espresso. Espresso making is totally new to me but after a few youtube videos on how to use espresso makers, I came across this, and for the price, it was a no brainer! It's sturdy, well built, strong, and easy to clean! If you got yourself an espresso maker for your home, I would highly recommend this in your barista toolset! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Justin T

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy little tamp, works great for expresso
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, sturdy tamp. I have used it for several months and it works great. It has two different sizes (the smaller one fits mine). I can get my coffee pressed for expresso without having to exert more pressure. My coffee is always great with this tamp, much better than the one I was using (was using one that came with my machine previously). It might not be sterling, or a piece for “display” but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: StPete73

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget for espresso tampering. Would buy again and again
customer_reviews.text: Loving this espresso tamper.. It fits great in my delonghi espresso portafilter. I am unsure why people are washing it after a few uses.. The espresso does not stick to it and i wipe it every few times with a paper towel. It is solid built and feels properly made. Makes tamping the espresso grinds much easier since the one i have is attached to the maxhine itself and is quite annoying to use.
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: Not top shelf, but for the low price, I like it.  Does the job inexpensively.
customer_reviews.text: It's not well made. You can see that. It appears to be cast in two halves, and then joined. You can plainly see the seams on mine. But it does the job. If you are on a budget, OR, if like me you use a tamper maybe 12 times a year, this is a good bargain. Not sure how long it will last, but with it just sitting on top of the Espresso machine 99 percent of the time, hopefully it will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Billy B

customer_reviews.title: Great tamper for expresso.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tamper a little over three months ago. Quality: I'm only using the small side due to my espresso machine dimensions. I only use this once or twice a day. I clean it up hand wash right after each use and let it air dry. I haven't had any issues of color degradation or oxidation. Still looks like new. Taste wise: I do feel an improvement in the taste of my coffee, which btw is really great puertorrican coffee. Overall: I highly recommend this tamper, is a good tamper at a nice price.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Made from inferior material.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! It turned black after it was washed in the dishwasher. And it cannot be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Veillette

customer_reviews.title: Makes your grounds pack the perfect punch
customer_reviews.text: If ya luv your espresso and are still looking for that perfect cup this little inexpensive tamper is the key. It fits in both small 300 ml or larger 600 ml plus Italian style coffee holders. If you just pour or fill the coffee unit without packing it down properly you will not "consistently" pull or perk your espresso to perfection.
customer_reviews.author: jumper

customer_reviews.title: So much better than plastic!
customer_reviews.text: The original tamper that came with my espresso machine was made of plastic. It does the trick, but I always worry that it's going to snap. THIS tamper solved all of that concern. I can pack that espresso in there so tight that my cup comes out perfect every time. Don't bother with plastic when you can have this tamper!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W

customer_reviews.title: Great Expresso Tamper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in 2013 to use with my expresso machine at the time. It worked great then and is still working great now. I've had to replace my expresso maker, but this tamper is still going strong with the new machine. It is very sturdy and easy to hold. Great price too, especially since it has lasted so long.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Nelson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - CANNOT WORK!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item was offered because I purchased a high end coffee station (i.e.> $200), therefore I (obviously improperly) assumed that the product had been confirmed as working with my station. It does not. The metal of the stamper has an edge / seam that won't allow the tamper to fit inside of the espresso unit so I can't use it at all. This tamper won't work with ANY espresso machine. Complete and total waste of money, and for whatever reason (I was sent to a very long list of item categories to dig through - no thank you) this item is not eligible for replacement or refund. BUYER BEWARE - IT WILL NOT WORK.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hayne

customer_reviews.title: Coated metal- never put in the dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: No washing instructions so I took a chance and threw it in the dishwasher. I should have read the reviews first as it ruined it- now a dark residue rubs off. Also left a gray residue on all the remaining clean dishes and had to be re washed. Ordered a better quality one without coating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and fits the De'Longhi EC-155
customer_reviews.text: This tamper fits my De'Longhi EC-155. The shape isn't the easiest to tamper but then again it is a reasonably priced entry level tamper that I am using on a entry level espresso machine and it works. I think the design is made to fit two different sizes of filters and the better shaped ones all cost at least 4 times the price of this. It does not say stainless steel like some reviewers claim, it says heavy cast alloy. I am not sure how long it will last but for around $5 it is way better then the plastic one my machine came with.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Marginally Made, But Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: It does the job so I really have nothing to complain about. It compresses ground coffee, so I should not have high expectations. My three star review is for two reasons. Firstly, it's very light and plated - I'm expecting the chrome to flake off eventually. Secondly, there is a "seam" right down the middle of the tamper, and runs the whole length of the device. It does not affect function, but on the other hand, no matter how I hold it I am also holding the seam, which feels cheap and unfinished. But again, ti's made to tamp coffee and that is what it does.
customer_reviews.author: MrVenom

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for what it's intended for. I have the De'Longhi EC155 espresso machine so I wanted a tamper that was a little more sturdy than the one that comes with the machine. The only reason I didn't give this tamper 5 stars is because I can only use one end. I was expecting to use the smaller end for one-shot and the larger end for the two-shot but the larger end doesn't fit in the double shot filter. It's a great product though and I'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie McGee

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: This a must have for any espresso machine! We have a manual espresso machine, and we hand make our shots. Without this our shots come out terribly! Great size, and perfect for really packing in the espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Carr

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and the right size
customer_reviews.text: I needed a specific-sized coffee tapper as the one attached to my new DeLonghi coffee maker was uncomfortable and awkward to use. This brand has different sizes that would fit your particular coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Mr. Coffee Machine
customer_reviews.text: The small end of this steamer is perfect for the Mr. Coffee Expresso Machine. I use it to flatten the coffee and compress it slightly. I don't really pack it down or the water has a hard time getting through it. The tamper allows me to fill the coffee basket with coffee, tamp it slightly, then wipe the rim clean of coffee so that there is a good, clean seal. This tamper doesn't work as well with my old Krups machine. The tamper is slight too big. But Krups doesn't make the machine I am talking about anymore, so I am not sure about their new machines.
customer_reviews.author: Keith H.

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not great
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit as well as I'd like. There are molding lines along the sides which means this isn't perfectly round. I was able to use a bench grinder to smooth those lines out a little but it still doesn't fit 100%. I was previously using a medicine bottle as the top matched up pretty well, I don't think this was much of an upgrade :/
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: this made all the difference, for me
customer_reviews.text: I have a DeLonghi EC155 espresso machine. It's got a built-in tamper. I bought this because Amazon suggested it, some coffee blogs echoed the recommendation, because the built-in tamper's a bit awkward to use, and, most importantly of all, because my espresso machine's tamper size is 52mm, which means a lot of the other tampers I saw on Amazon were too big. I had my doubts about this but I said why not, it's only $7. turned out great. without this, my espresso machine is OK. with this, my espresso machine creates absolutely fantastic espresso. essential product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Gibbly Bibko

customer_reviews.title: Check the size of your espresso machine before ordering!
customer_reviews.text: This one didn't match the size of the espresso maker I bought, so it collects dust in the cupboard. It's not bad, just not worth the hassle of returning it. The build quality is solid, if not for the mismatch in size with my espresso machine it'd be in daily use today.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Will work fine I'm sure but if you make lattes everyday you ...
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday, thankfully fit works with my espresso machine. It feels very cheaply made. No heft to it, even though it is 'metal'. Will work fine I'm sure but if you make lattes everyday you might want to look at something a little more robust.
customer_reviews.author: P. Klissas

customer_reviews.title: Skip it
customer_reviews.text: In the picture on Amazon it looks like a metal tamper. In person it looks like a piece of plastic that’s been painted. Not worth wasting your money.
customer_reviews.author: Holtphens

customer_reviews.title: Too small or too large for me and super light weight
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't quite fit my espresso machine cup. The small side is a little too small so it leaves coffee edges when it tamps and the big side is too big. I have 2 Starbucks machines and they require a tamp that leaves the espresso beans lower than the level of the cup so maybe it would work it you just need to level something straight across the cup. It is very light with no real weight of its own. It is fine for smoothing the top of a homemade coffee refill cup but next time I guess I'll have to check the measurements carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Macchiarella

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product but was bigger than what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product but was bigger than what I needed, it could just be an issue with my machine as I measured the top not the bottom of the espresso holder, I advise measuring the bottom or the line to which you fill it to (although it's almost impossible to find a smaller one)
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha C. Corp

customer_reviews.title: It does its job, I guess
customer_reviews.text: I'm no espresso snob like some people in the "espresso culture" seem to be, so I can't really speak about this tamper with any level of guru knowledge. It packs down the grains...what else do you want? Its alloy, so it looks cool, and matches my setup. The only problem I have is that its like a mm too small circumference wise so it doesn't fit perfectly in my little handle thingy. (told you I was a newb at espresso-ing!) Still, its not that big of a problem, and its 1000 times easier and better than the attached plastic tamper thats on my machine. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly new to espresso making, so my opinion is based solely off of what I observe. This was inexpensive, easy, and a MUCH better alternative to the plastic version that came with my espresso machine. It made a big difference in producing consistent shots!
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for Gaggia 14101
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tamper for the price. The larger side works great for our new Gaggia 14101 Espresso Machine, it came with a came cheap plastic tamper.
customer_reviews.author: Manfred M.

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mr. Coffee espresso maker (not sure about the model, but it's a pretty basic machine.) I measured the inside of the filter before buying this and it was about 53 mm - the small end of this tamper fits perfectly. I lost the plastic scoop that came with the machine and was using a spoon before purchasing this... never fully understood the importance of even tamping until I tried the difference. I have no experience with more expensive tampers, but what more could ask for? This is flat and smooth and sturdy... unless you're looking for a small work of art instead of a kitchen tool, this will suit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: DeweyDellTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: After I had done most of the grinding I smoothed it down with a fine grit flapper sanding wheel
customer_reviews.text: The measurements were as it said but I failed to measure my grounds cup correctly. My grounds cup is tapered and has a level 2 and 4. I had to grind down the 51mm side to 49mm and the 58mm side to 50mm. The material that it is made of is very durable and I had to use a grinder to turn it down to the sizes I needed. The side view of the tamper looks to be deeply scratch but it is smooth. After I had done most of the grinding I smoothed it down with a fine grit flapper sanding wheel. I also number stamped the ends to make it easy to know which side is which.
customer_reviews.author: BellaVida67

customer_reviews.title: Not dishwasher safe I found out.
customer_reviews.text: Got this in 2 days ago and because we're in a pandemic I put it in the dishwasher. When I pulled it out it looked like this. The silver sheen was gone. So.... It's still functional but not shiny and silver. Just a word of warning.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Love this handy tamper!
customer_reviews.text: How did I live so long without a tamper for making espresso. This little jewel works well at firmly lacking in ground espresso.
customer_reviews.author: KayW in MD

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and does a great job
customer_reviews.text: 50mm tamper little bit oversized on my La Pavoni Pre Millenium basket but a couple of minutes sanding and I have a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Crane

customer_reviews.title: Great choice if you don't know what size your portafilter is, but it discolored after one dishwasher cycle.
customer_reviews.text: I'd recommend this product if you're a little unsure of the size of your portafilter (mine is small, so the smaller size of the tamper is a great fit). However, I was disappointed when I ran the tamper through the dishwasher upon arrival, and it became discolored almost immediately. Ultimately, I'm still happy with the utility of the tamper, but not very happy with how it looks after just one wash.
customer_reviews.author: TLC

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the beginner.
customer_reviews.text: Ok tamper didn’t like the metal seem line along it. The 49 or 50mm side is a tight squeeze but that’s to be expected with the variances in products. I kept it regardless. Make sure you know your basket size before ordering. VERY IMPORTANT .
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t even know something like this existed until I saw a YouTube video. I’ve used it for some many things
customer_reviews.author: autumn

customer_reviews.title: NOT DISHWASHER SAFE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I put this in the dishwasher and it turned dark grey and metallic powder coated my hands after touching. My hands are now burning. Wtf is this made out of!?
customer_reviews.author: Liam Watkins

customer_reviews.title: An effective tamper.
customer_reviews.text: The product was delivered and recieved in a timely manner. It was well packaged and free from any defect. I liked the affordable price most. It is simple in design and is an effective tool for tamping espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Fine by me
customer_reviews.text: While the Amazon ad currently says "Dishwasher safe", the box it comes in specifically says it's not and "hand wash". Fine by me, I don't consider that a flaw given the price. It fits the basket on my machine perfectly - make sure you get the right size tamper. You can't fault a product if you don't buy the right size. For the price, this is a great buy. A more expensive tamper is not going to tamp any better or fit the basket on my machine any better. I've washed it repeatedly and I cannot see any deterioration. The only question for me is lifetime. If it ever shows flecking I'll re-review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and professional
customer_reviews.text: Very professional and convenient double sided are the two most common sizes. Our home espresso is the small side
customer_reviews.author: Chris Conrad

customer_reviews.title: bought it for the DeLonghi EC155- works well!
customer_reviews.text: I got my hubby the DeLonghi EC155 and thought he would use the Lavazza pods, but he decided to go with using real coffee. This tamper was recommended by others who own is machine, and they were right- the small end works well. Yes, you may have to rotate it a bit to cover all the surface area, but it really isn't that complicated. This + the DeLonghi machine gives my hubby a beautiful cuppa with lots of beautiful crema, just like he wanted. It's simple, inexpensive, and does what you need it to do. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Giampa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality tamp
customer_reviews.text: Really cheap quality. It feels toy'ish due to the weight (or lack thereof) of it. The surface of the tamp came really banged up up with bumps on it and the edges were really knicked. It prevents a nice smooth tamp, especially if you like to twist the tamp after applying pressure. Spend a few dollars extra and get the Bluesnail tamp, that one is way better quality and weight.
customer_reviews.author: audiophile

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME TOOL!
customer_reviews.text: Thus is a MUST HAVE! if you own an expresso machine. Perfect fit and works like a charm! Ya gotta own one.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Ok Quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice build, use this for my mini espresso machine, the other end is too big so only use the other end smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: John ava

customer_reviews.text: Feels super cheap. Ugly as heck. I Wish that I bought a different one. Other than it's appearance, it works.
customer_reviews.author: luis zazueta

customer_reviews.title: Casting Issues But Overall a Nifty Tool
customer_reviews.text: The tamper I received wasn't finished properly and the ridges from it's casting prevent it from being of use until filed off. Not that big a deal for me personally but it might be for someone else. With rough edges filed off, this fits my Krups espresso machine perfectly. As mentioned by other reviewers, THIS IS NOT DISHWASHER SAFE even though it states it is on the tag and on this page. Dishwasher detergent and aluminum items do not like each other. Aluminum will corrode very rapidly. It doesn't take much to clean by hand anyway. As a side note, never put cast iron items in your dishwasher either, they will rust heavily immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Field

customer_reviews.title: Not dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of putting this in the dishwasher and the finish was destroyed. It's now a dull gray color instead bright and shiny. Still works, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: HeyItsMe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and weight
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different tampers, and I needed something cheap to use at work. I honestly was not expecting much from this tamper, especially at the low price. It works great! The 60mm side fits most commercial size portafilters, while the 50mm size fits Krups, Delonghi, and other consumer/low end machines. The weight is perfect, and the high polish prevents grounds from sticking to the tamper. The shape fits my hand perfectly, and makes an even tamp and twist very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tedomatic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect TAM
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to pack our fresh ground coffee. Totally satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: J Lillie

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help with making expresso. It had some bad burrs on it where it came together but I fixed that with some fine sandpaper. It works a lot better now. Thank you and enjoy your day.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Very quality material. The only complaint is that it doesn't fit well in espresso machine. I have a SOWTECH. Base was a little to big to pack espresso down tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tapper
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for tapping the expresso. Water should go through packed grounds for the best taste. It works great
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Tully

customer_reviews.title: Was a very good product but the parts are cheap and won't last
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last very long. About 3 month before I started noticing the pump was acting up. Now 4 months in and the froth gives out. Was a very good product but the parts are cheap and won't last. Also developed a leak. I'm thinking about sending it in on warranty but I might not bother as a lot of people have said it's pointless.
customer_reviews.author: tomwadek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect accessory for my DeLonghi espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: Based upon the recommendations of others, I ordered Terry's Tamper along with a DeLonghi coffee maker. The tamper arrived very quickly and prior to the DeLonghi. Though the directions included with the DeLonghi did not stress tamping as an important step in the coffee-making process, I know from experience that it is quite important to achieve the coveted "crema" inherent to a perfect espresso. This tamper does that easily and effectively and far exceeds the utility of the built-in DeLonghi tamper (an awkward plastic disk attached to the machine). This accessory is an important to a good cup of coffee as a proper steaming pitcher is to good steamed milk.
customer_reviews.author: SiberianLover

customer_reviews.title: If you love espresso you need a tamper.
customer_reviews.text: We love fresh grind coffee and the tamper is for proper load of grinds.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Frail

customer_reviews.title: Product is OK and arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: Product is OK and arrived on time - nothing extra here. But, since the coffee maker for which it was intended had to be returned, I now have an expensive paperweight. Bad plan. Will try to sell - of course, as a used product.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Jeff

customer_reviews.title: I mean, we HAD to buy it, according to my 16 yr old.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly, I guess it’s to press espresso stuff down. My 16 yr old guilted me into buying it for her espresso machine. I make her make me espressos now. Win win.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Pugh

customer_reviews.title: perfect for most espresso machines
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a plastic version that came with my espresso machine. This metal one is heavier and very durable. The smaller circle of the tamper fits my espresso maker perfectly. The other side of the tamper is too large for my machine. I suppose if I had a professional espresso maker, this larger side would be made for that one. It cleans easily and I have not noticed any wear or defects after using it for a little while. It did roll off the counter onto the ground once but no damage at all.
customer_reviews.author: L. Carter

customer_reviews.title: ... this "RSVP Terry's Tamper" for 5 years and it's perfect. It's sturdy and fits the coffee filter basket ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this "RSVP Terry's Tamper" for 5 years and it's perfect. It's sturdy and fits the coffee filter basket of my De'Longhi espresso maker perfectly. It's easy to grip and tamps down evenly. I use it every day, and I've seen no signs of disintegration or tarnishing of the metal.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Mulcahy

customer_reviews.title: May want to research other options. But will do the job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty heavy set tamp. Two complaints. The small end is shy or being the right size for my piece. Also, there is a small left over ridge from the casting process on its' side. This can be ground down, but it will sometimes dig into the grinds when your are putting pressure into them.
customer_reviews.author: dv8apex

customer_reviews.title: This product is useless for use on the Mr. Coffee Capachino machine!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tamper because it was "suggested" as an item that is often bought along with the Mr., Coffee Cappachino machine that I ordered. The problem is, the coffee machine comes with its own tamper that works well and actually fits the coffee holder. This product is completely useless to me, its only valuable use is to be used as a paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but had to return.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return because espresso maker that was ordered separately contained a tamper
customer_reviews.author: Jim J

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Nice
customer_reviews.text: Dont forget its heavy die cast aluminum alloy designed NOT REALLY STEEL not heavy.. but it works. fit nice. When u hold it .. u can feel its so cheap cause not heavy enough but it works.. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kursat

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Perfect double sided tamper with 2 different sizes. I have a mega coffee maker and a personal one and I can use this tamper for whichever I choose to use that day. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I expected. The material is aluminum, I think. Light weight. Works for what it was intended.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for the espresso maker we got. Only quibble is I wish the label was easier to peel off - lol.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Trayling

customer_reviews.title: May not work with all Espresso makers
customer_reviews.text: go to your espresso maker and check the cup, if it has indentations for measurements this product wont work. its not a problem with the product itself but i have 2 different machines to make espresso and they both have the measurement indentation. this small bit of metal catches the tamper and doesent allow you to get an even press because you have to angle it to get it past the measurement mark.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tamp for my Cafe Barista. This one fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CLo2006

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: Great- don’t put in the dishwasher or the finish comes off
customer_reviews.author: Nicooleykid

customer_reviews.title: Ok craft mat
customer_reviews.text: I like the he color and size of this craft mat, but I was annoyed that it comes rolled up and never smoothed out completely. It always had a bump in part of it. Some materials easily wiped off but it quickly became stained with use in my experience. Will get the job done protecting your desk.
customer_reviews.author: SLW5122

customer_reviews.title: Standard Size
customer_reviews.text: Standard Size Espresso press. High quality, sturdy, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hayghe

customer_reviews.title: Not Exactly 58mm
customer_reviews.text: This tamper is not exactly 58mm on both ends. If you use it on most of the espresso machines, it won't fit the standard 58mm portafilter. I measured the diameters, they are 56mm and 62mm. Meaning when you tamp, it at least takes 2X or 3X time because you need to work on the edge. It is 8 dollars, but if I knew, I would probably spend a little bit more to buy the Rattleware  If you are serious about Espresso, don't buy the $20 blade grinder and the $8 tamper. Spend a little time to research on h0me barista or coffee geek.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Works great with no coffee grinds getting stuck on the highly polished metal surface
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a new espresso machine, the totally manual kind and I needed a Tamper. This unit has two sizes, the smaller one happened to be the right one for me. It works just as advertised. One nice detail is that the metal is so highly brushed and smooth that no coffee grinds get stuck on the surface. Its a very low cost item, and it works great minimizing mess in the kitchen and making a great espresso in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Per

customer_reviews.title: Hand wash only!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: For a simple item, it has equal quality. Hand wash only. I put the item in the dishwasher and it remove the outter coating, leaving just the bare cast metal. I wouldn't think it is food safe any more and has no longer been used. Cheap metal cheap coating cheap manufacturing Lesson, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: jfunk7094

customer_reviews.title: Does not measure 2 1/4 inches. Actually is 2 3/16
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality and Price. I only gave it 2 stars because of mis advertised size. I needed 2 /14 for a perfect pack. Being a hair too small leaves a rim of espresso unpacked. Change the size description and future customers will have no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Cheap is not always a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: CHEAP means CHEAP. Go ahead ans spend a little more. The surface needs to be very smooth, but it is not.
customer_reviews.author: insun hardymon

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This fits in my hand so well and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: t.Reed

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Dishwasher!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tamper to use with my Breville cappuccino machine. The tamper itself works great. It fits perfectly into the slot and evenly packs the espresso. The problem comes in when you put the tamper into the dishwasher. The product information says that this is dishwasher safe, but this could not be father from the truth. The first time mine came out of the dishwasher, it was no longer chrome colored, it was a dirty aluminum looking tamper covered in some black liquid. I am not sure what washed off of the tamper in the dishwasher, but I would not recommend putting this in the dishwasher because it will cause big issues for you.
customer_reviews.author: JJ R.

customer_reviews.title: Two Flat Tamping Sides, bith useless
customer_reviews.text: 1 side is too big, other is too small which leaves big gaps around the side of the portafilter basket.
customer_reviews.author: Piya

customer_reviews.title: Decent No-Frills Tamper
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, no-frills tamper. If you're used to a professional-grade tamper that is much heavier you'll have to get used to putting in more arm strength to get a good tamp but after a few tries, you should have it down.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Martin

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be giving me more consistency and more foam
customer_reviews.text: I've never used one of these before. there was a tamper on the espresso machine I had been using, but it didn't tamp the coffee down very well. This does. I believe I'm getting more consistency and more foam now that I'm tamping the coffee down.
customer_reviews.author: Populo Iratus

customer_reviews.title: Yes, you need a tamper - and this is a good one
customer_reviews.text: If you are making espresso, you need a product like this. It works a million times better than trying to use a spoon. The smal end is exactly the right size for use with my DeLonghi espresso maker. Some people complain that you shouldn't put in the dishwasher. News flash: you don't really need to wash this. Just wipe off the coffee and put it away. Or rinse it by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Baker

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars for two reason. 1. It's lightweight ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars for two reason. 1. It's lightweight and just feels kind of cheap. 2. They put the UPC sticker on the side that I have to use to press my coffee grinds and it's impossible to get the glue off so now I press my coffee and some of it gets stuck to the surface of the tamper. Small annoyances but I still don't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Justesen

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't fit my espresso machine's espresso holder that well and it's hard to get the pressure right because this is so lightweight. I went to cash and Cary and bought a heavier, tear drop handled one like the coffee shops use and am much happier with that. Also, because of the alloy this is made of, it now has weird 'salt spots' from my dishwasher soap. It had some kind of weird reaction. It's still usable, but looks dirty forever.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use with the Mr. Coffee ECM160 4-Cup Steam Espresso Machine ( after seeing others' reviews that they wanted it for the same thing. Just like others have said, it will not fit all the way down to the bottom of the filter cup, but it will go down to about the 2 cup mark, which is perfect for making one big travel mug of coffee in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Dauphin

customer_reviews.title: This tamper is completely unusable. It is HUGE - ...
customer_reviews.text: This tamper is completely unusable. It is HUGE - I have never seen an espresso machine that could accommodate something so large - seriously the large end is about 3inches in diameter and the "small" end is over 2 inches. I guess if you have a large industrial machine that makes 10 shots at a time this might be feasible to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bibliomom

customer_reviews.title: The size does not fit my coffee machine
customer_reviews.text: It's durable but too big for my coffee machine. Could be smaller based on the size description.
customer_reviews.author: chenghu xianyu

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It does what it needs to, just rinse it off under the tap afterwards and dry with a paper towel. It is aluminium and the metal will likely oxidize if you put it in the dishwasher; it says handwash only on the tag. If you do not have extra tiny hands it should not be hard to fit in the palm of your hand. I think a lot of the low reviews have some odd expectations for a 7 dollar hunk of metal.
customer_reviews.author: <redacted>

customer_reviews.title: espresso. Great
customer_reviews.text: Fit my Mr Coffee espresso/coffee maker perfectly. Makes great expresso.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D Kister

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: It was beautiful when I first received it. It looked like solid stainless steel and felt like it also. However, one trip through the dishwasher and it was all pitted and rough. What a piece of junk. Before you order this check on your espresso maker because mine actually came with one!
customer_reviews.author: Cali Ventura

customer_reviews.title: Great product but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Great product but not very durable. The finish is getting ruined after 6 months of hand washing. Still functional though:
customer_reviews.author: kapil kirpekar

customer_reviews.title: Tamper Works
customer_reviews.text: This was an unnecessary but fortuitous purchase. The expresso machine I bought at the same time came with a plastic tamper (not mentioned in the description). However, I have used both and like this much better. It is light weight alloy but very solid and comfortable to hold and use. The diameter is slightly smaller than the diameter of my coffee holder, but it works much better and faster than the plastic one. I have ditched the plastic one!
customer_reviews.author: Randall L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't look cheap to me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tamper to use with my Mr. Coffee machine. I bought it from A&L because their shipping rate was cheap and it came fast. It's 1-2mm too big for my machine though (I'm ordering another tamper that's smaller -48/49mm). I'm deciding to keep it since I intend to keep making cappuccinos at home and I will definitely replace my current machine once it breaks down so this tamper may be useful for my next machine/s. I think it's a pretty good tamper. I like the weight and the feel of it in my hands as well as the flat ends. It's shiny and very simple in design and I don't think it looks cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Seacell

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, this product is cheaply made. It has rough edges along the circumference and tarnishes very easily. That being said, it still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stephens

product_meta.title: RSVP International Dual Sided Coffee Espresso Tamper | Two Flat Tamping Sides | Distribute, Compress & Level Ground Coffee | For Coffee Shops or Home Use
product_meta.description: Rsvp strives to offer quality kitchen products and cooking tools at competitive prices. Our Terry’s espresso tamper is a perfect example. Made of tumble finished long lasting cast alloy with no chemical coating that resists corrosion from acids found in Coffee. A must have for all baristas both professional and novice. The dual ends of this tamper evenly distributes, compress and level ground Coffee for a denser, richer and more flavorful espresso brew. Features two flat tamping sides; 51mm (2-inches) and 58mm (2-1/4-inches). measures 2-3/4-inches by 2-1/4-inches by 2-3/4-inches overall. Hand wash. When all the right people, and ingredients, kitchen tools, and food come together, we call this the art of gathering.
feature_bullets: Made of tumble finished long lasting cast alloy with no chemical coating that resists corrosion from acids found in coffee

The dual ends of this tamper evenly distributes, compress and level ground coffee for a denser, richer and more flavorful espresso brew. Features two flat tamping sides; 51mm (2-inches) and 58mm (2-1/4-inches)
Commercial quality, heavy die cast aluminum alloy designed by a professional barista for the expert or home espresso maker
A must have for all baristas both professional and novice. Is also great to use in your kitchen to tamp and press pastry into pans or create mini slider patties
Easy to clean simply hand wash with warm soapy water, dry thoroughly
